website_summaries.verdict: A very good first microscope that offers everything young scientists need to get started.
pros: Magnification up to 1200x and comes with a handy case and good experiments and accessories
cons: Fixed optics and battery operated only
Much of the construction, including the lenses, is plastic

website_summaries.verdict: Many parents remember their own microscope kits from  childhood as being better made but still recommend this kit for young science enthusiasts.
pros: A must-have for kids who are inspired by science and want to look at tiny and microscopic details
cons: Includes small pieces that can be challenging for small hands to maneuver
Some of the components are flimsy
Microscope lens can be difficult to adjust

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT GIFT!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 9 year old grandson for his birthday. The look on his face when he opened it said how much he liked it. We spent a lot of times looking at the prepared slides and he and his father were going to make more of their own thanks to the directions that explained how. As a retired teacher, I love the fact that I can give something educational as a present and still see all the joy that it brings. We were all impressed with the microscope and how easy it was to use.
customer_reviews.author: Roslyn M. Santay

customer_reviews.title: Be fore-warned!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son has become a total pain in the you-know-what!! All I hear is,"hey, Dad, check this out! Hey Dad, Dad, Dad, look at this!". My days are now spent gathering samples of pond scum and swamp water for examination.Seriously, though, he loves it! The only thing to be aware of is that almost the entire scope is made of plastic. Even the chrome is just chromed plastic. This does not affect the functionality at all, but it is worth mentioning. Overall, it works great, and is a great way to spark their imagination.
customer_reviews.author: Dave T

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY WELL DONE, AND WORTH PURCHASING
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice Microscope Kit. I purchased this for my 7 year old granddaughter and it's got everything she will need for many years to come. I will say it is a little too advanced for her and she has to have help to use it. Focusing the microscope is something of a challenge and she can't just grab it and look at something, so that was disappointing for her. I think it is very appropriate for an older child, but 7 is just too young. It's way to involved.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Down South

customer_reviews.title: great little kit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this microscope kit for my nine-year-old daughter. She wanted "spy supplies," for Christmas, so we got her this kit to go along with other items. She enjoys science, chemistry, and anything possibly related to forensics. This kit is sturdy, and provides plenty magnification for our needs. We've completed a few of the experiments from the kit, and my daughter found those enjoyable. We did purchase extra glass slides from our local arts and crafts store, because my daughter wanted to keep her slide collection and label some of her favorite items. I would recommend this kit for the little scientist in your life.
customer_reviews.author: Hpg

customer_reviews.title: and would not recommend to others
customer_reviews.text: My son did not even get to use this once! We pulled it out of the box and a piece on the microscope came right off and when you turn the knobs the microscope does not go up and down. I will be returning the product, and would not recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hartsock

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made lenses of plastic - broken on arrival!
customer_reviews.text: Broken on arrival! The primary lens that is supposed to be secured in the viewing tube had come detatched and was rattling around inside. We couldn't see a thing! Also, that lens is made of cheap plastic. We had high hopes that our grandkids would get a charge out of the microscopic world but not to be. Very dissapointed!
customer_reviews.author: Treibs

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price! Bought it for homeschooling and the kids love it. They are 9, 10, & 11 and can use it without any help. Came with some great extras and has already provided hours of entertainment! Would recommend for any grade school aged children.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Deeply disappointed and I have no desire to try again
customer_reviews.text: We returned this item before giving it to our nephew once we discovered that nothing on it even worked. Deeply disappointed and I have no desire to try again.
customer_reviews.author: Last Boone

customer_reviews.title: I liked the carrying case
customer_reviews.text: Did not work upon arrival and I had to send it back (it was purchased as a gift so this was inconvenient and annoying). I liked the carrying case, but quality is might be 'ok' for a 6 year old. Felt cheap & did not have any 'weight' to it. I purchased for a 12 year old birthday gift, and had it not arrived broken, I would have still returned it due to it being small and low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Benno

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work as intended. Some quality control issues as the product I received had dirty lenses. Tried wiping all the lenses I could access but could get rid of what looks like soap film. Wish there was more Q&A prior to shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect more then you pay for, but this is a ok product for the price. Got it for my daughters 7th b-day... she Likes It. And i have to admit, the imaging is better then i expected, but it is cheap plastic (only the arm is metal). The photos are of horse hair through the microscope, pictures taken by my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Gaelon Swift

customer_reviews.title: Initially I was pleased at the appearance of the kit but I was ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my granddaughter for Christmas. She is 8 and very interested in science.Initially I was pleased at the appearance of the kit but I was soon disappointed because we could not focus it sufficiently to see the slides. After an hour we gave up! I’m going to buy her a better one. I didn’t have the heart to take it from her to return it. I know this was a beginner set but I thought she would at least be able to see the slides provided.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The slides seem like the most quality item in this kit
customer_reviews.text: Cheap mostly plastic could not even see the slide moving in and out let alone the specimen. One lens seems waterspotted. Could be missing something internally just a hollow tube between the lenses. The slides seem like the most quality item in this kit. Obviously did not try growing the shrimp as had no way to look at them. Very disappointing. Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Seth Nelson

customer_reviews.title: no light switch for the microscope light.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with no instructions and pieces missing. Also there is no light switch for the microscope light. You have to unscrew the base and disconnect the battery every time you wish to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce B.

customer_reviews.title: Cant see anything with it. Very cheapy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Christmas gift and you can't see anything with it. It's cheapy . Very dissapointing
customer_reviews.author: John Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today, will be homeschooling this year this is absolutely perfect for my 7 year old! Took it out right away to test it and it does a great job! I do have experience with a microscope and I have read the negative comments, this works wonderfully for a beginner or to show an elementary school level child different cells. Not a waste of money! Would suggest to any home schooler and perfectly happy with my purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie S

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice looking set, but not useable
customer_reviews.text: If you want to get your child a Microscope, then spend the money, so you can enjoy it as much as your child, at least $100 plus just for the scope, to get one that works, with glass lens. This set is for show, nothing more. You aren't about to distinguish between the fine scratches on the plastic lens and the item you're trying to focus on, pretty much a toy for show, not useable for anyone. I really don't want to put this kit down to much, it's only 40 bucks, and what do you expect, it comes with a case, tube, tools, lens plates, you can't expect any kind quality at the price.
customer_reviews.author: Max Carrte'

customer_reviews.title: Good set, didn’t meet my needs
customer_reviews.text: I got this in hopes the microscope could help me discover new worlds, but the only thing I discovered was my wife having an affair. Also has some other cool goddies that come in the kit.
customer_reviews.author: JHW

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Christmas present & when the time finally came it is not working. I am past the return date, but I didn't know the date. Really sad to have something & not be able to use it or return it.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this microscope to identify the strain of dinoflagellates ( ostreopsis ) that I have in my reef tank and am very happy I made the purchase. The price point is what converted me and I have since recommended the product to others and have sent them the direct link. My children have also found it very entertaining to use the microscope and view the microscopic life that lives in our salt water aquarium. Feed back: the light may flicker or go very dim due to poor contacts on the sides resulting in eye strain... to fix temporarily, gently squeeze the sides where the light pivots for better electrical contact and steadier light flow.
customer_reviews.author: casey durazo

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After carefully adjusting the focus and lighting I still couldn't see any of the pre-packed slides only blur and light. It's built solid, but I think the optics are defective (no obvious shipping damage).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... for my 9 year old son and he has enjoyed it. I wish the microscope itself had a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 9 year old son and he has enjoyed it. I wish the microscope itself had a little more weight to it because when you look into the eye piece you can tilt it and that's just kind of annoying when you're trying to pretend to be a legit scientist. The slides that were included were pretty fun to look at. I also ordered some blank slides so that we could make out own, but they just don't come out the same. The premade ones are way better. Overall we really enjoyed this product! 👍
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It's a good set, no real complaints. I got this for my 7 year old for CMas. I'm giving it 3 stars because I'm missing a lens (forget the magnification). Other than than, it's a typical home microscope/kit. It's metal so don't fret about it being flimsy. As for the lens, it could be my fault in the haze of unwrapping but I don't think I'm the only one to complain about it. It's probably not a deal breaker and it may be just me.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Palmertree

customer_reviews.title: Great for a beginner!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for a beginner, bought for my son's 10th birthday. It seems very sturdy, and numerous possibilities for scientific exploration! I especially like the carrying case - very handy to keep everything together. I also like the fact that it comes with accessories, extra slides, the shrimp kit, tools for making more slides. It arrived promptly, which was very nice. One drawback, the package arrived very beat up. The plastic shipping bag was actually open. The microscope was unharmed, as well as most of the accessories. However, the forceps were missing.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C Peters

customer_reviews.title: Not enough quality control
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews, wanted an inexpensive microscope for a budding young scientist. It arrived in the great case for keeping all pieces together. All the parts seemed to be there. While it is metal, all moving parts are plastic. It was light weight and possibly not as stable as a younger child needs? It was very easy to remove the three screws to insert the batteries. The glass that the slide goes over is scratched. All views are affected by that issue. I will return and find a better quality , I hope.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Harley

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: The slides were not working properly because I couldn’t see anything in the slides with any magnification even with the bright light going directly through my eyeball. It didn’t matter what magnification and what color I used, the only thing that worked properly was the bulb that was too bright. Overall, poor quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: For the cost, it's decent.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, and the fact that it's for a 9 year old, it's a decent product. I can't give it 5 starts given the fact that when you use the adjustment to lift and lower the eye piece, it shifts the entire part and you loose what are looking at in the viewer. I know that I can't expect it to work like a professional microscope, but they should at least figure a way to make that work better.
customer_reviews.author: ZumaKyle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 5 year old daughter for her birthday. Obviously I had to break it out and test it before I gave it to her. Great beginner microscope! We got good magnification and were able to look at many household things, bugs, and hair. We looked at a tick (pictured) we found while hiking and I was able to line my phone up with the neck so we could talk about the different parts. We took cheek scrapings and she was amazed at the nucleus (we dyed it with the eosin dye.) it’s a great way to teach and interact with daily things differently as she now says “let’s look at that under the microscope!”
customer_reviews.author: kake

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this product. I bought it for my granddaughter for Christmas last year. It got misplaced and was just recently found in the back of her closet. With excitement we assembled it and tried using(following the directions) it. After 2 hours the only thing we could see was a squiggly line, no matter what slide we have in. My husband, myself, my son and my brother in law tried getting it took work. My grand daughter is/was very disappointed. Just a warning Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.author: Philip V.

customer_reviews.title: Great Kid Microscope!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic microscope for a budding scientist! I got this for my daughter’s best friend who is very into science. Even her birthday party theme was Science. It is very comprehensive and works very well. She and my daughter have used it many many times and they have spent hours using it. They love getting random things to enlarge it and examine it. It is a great gift to encourage STEM learning!
customer_reviews.author: JoJo S.

customer_reviews.title: Father and son love this!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a good buy for homeschooling. I got it for my 4 year old who loves to look at the world throw a microscope loves all stuff science. and keeps thinking of things to look at throw his microscope. My husband also loved it.( thinking maybe fathers day gift for the fathers who love science.) Found out my husband always wanted one as a kid ,never thought about getting one for him. now my son and husband Have some thing they both love and are excited about sharing with each other.
customer_reviews.author: Rainstar

customer_reviews.title: Junk !
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our homeschool science lessons and it was extremely hard to look at the slides . It’s so small that you see your eyelashes and you can’t adjust it the way you need it to be to see the slides . It was a waste of money . It also , comes with a sharp tool so beware if you have small kids .
customer_reviews.author: kimberly Michelle Mellott

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and frustrating
customer_reviews.text: What I wanted to do was to get my 11 year old grandson excited about a microscope. And he was, right up to the point where we turned it on and tried to get our specimens in focus. Most of what you see is tiny debris and fibers on the lens, slides, light - couldn't clean it enough for a clear view. The whole thing is cheaply made, silver painted plastic and the case is nice but things were loose inside when it arrived. Hopefully I can revive his enthusiasm when the better one arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy KH

customer_reviews.title: Box was missing items and Amscope would not replace!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this microscope set for my daughters and due to the COVID shutdown and a move across country, it took us a while to open the box. When we finally opened the brand new box, we realized the box was missing some items. I emailed Amscope to let them know and after they requested the receipt THREE TIMES and I sent it, they said, "Oh, sorry, we can't do anything." Not only did they not stand behind their product, they wasted my time and disappointed a couple of young girls.
customer_reviews.author: Executive Mom

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful birthday gift to a young explorer
customer_reviews.text: Got two of them, one for daughter and one for my niece, both around 7 / 8 years. The microscope has everything that is needed to get started. A world of amazement awaits them once they learn how to use this. There is a small learning curve but once known it is easy to use. There are tones of slides pre-done and some available for them to use to make up their own specimen. It is good for 8 - 12 years olds with an interest in science and hands on learning.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed Irfan

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The only nice thing that I can say about this product is a carrier 😡😡 Otherwise very cheaply made and way smaller that it seems to be on the pictures. The material that looks like metal is a cheap plastic. Also, manual is not clear. It says that we should add a quarter of water to the tiny container that wouldn't fit 1/4 of cup (look at the pictures). It was birthday gift for my daughter. We are very disappointed, will try to return but already throw away a box so not sure if we still can.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: This microscope is inadequate!  Do not buy it!
customer_reviews.text: The case and supplies which accompany this microscope are great. However, the microscope itself is simply awful. The basic scope is cheaply made. It does not focus. You cannot see anything. The light source is extremely poor. I have used microscopes professionally for years and this one was impossible. I was very disappointed because I got it to introduce my 7 year old grandson to microscopes. Incidentally we replaced it with an AmScope in a similar price range which is absolutely top notch!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Fleming

customer_reviews.title: For the little chemist with inquiring minds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew for his birthday. I haven’t had any complaints. so I’m gonna go with it’s a pretty awesome product. I saw it, it has real slides, some premade, others you can make yourself. I would say it’s an all-around great product. not for little ones, 10-year-olds or better.. I would say probably some adult supervision is required.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: OK for a beginner scientist
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the microscope I got for Christmas as a kid (many decades ago). The crank focus of the old microscope broke as well as the light stopped working. This microscope is ok, nice focus. Everything is plastic; my original microscope was all metal. Sign of the times. Slides are plastic, which might be preferred. My original slides were glass...all broken now. The LED light is rather bright, best if turned away a bit. Overall, a nice package for a beginning scientist!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: For those who haven't tried other products, I have to tell you, the product itself is very small in size, the material is very cheap, and the quality of the image is very very poor. I have bought a better one but that was only 120X at the price of around $70. So I bought this one which is 1000X at only $40 something and intended to return the other one. When i watch the same thing using these two products, it reversed my plan. Just don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: zhongxiadu

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I want to start by saying this is an amazing product. It had an additional eyepice with a 20x magnification, which is amazing, but the issue is the 1200x objective lens had a fracture upon arrival. The 20x eyepiece made it easy to have high magnification when paired with the 600x objective, but I would love to have been able to see superfine particles and individual cells/diatomes.
customer_reviews.author: chris bolton

customer_reviews.title: impressive for the price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used a microscope in years, but after a few minutes I had this focused and working. I made a couple of my own slides and shared with my 7 and 4 year old. Both of my children have an affinity for science and found this to me really "neat. " If you want to spark your child's interest in science let them discover things at a cellular level. I would recommend this microscope to anybody interested in getting their children interested in science.
customer_reviews.author: David B Leach II

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work well at all. I just needed something to look at household items (like bugs) for identification, and you can't find the object on the slide/stage. I wouldn't buy this for my kid.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Burt

customer_reviews.title: look for defective lenses
customer_reviews.text: Like: accessory pieces adequate dislike: the 1st order was fun for a day, until I noticed a round object at high magnification. I focused on it and tried to center it by moving the slide. I discovered the image did not move and I could even remove the slide completely.. I returned for exchange at a nearby outpost and received a replacement. I repeated the testing on the 2nd unit. The image was similar to the 1st unit but in a different orientation. Again I could remove the slide - the image did not change. poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Christine S.

customer_reviews.title: False advertising by Amscope and lack of responsibility on Amazon’s part.
customer_reviews.text: The microscope does not magnify as specified on the details on description of said item . Returning is nearly impossible so far. I’m getting messages of they said this and they are responsible not us. I think at this point amazon dropped the ball on this one , do I’m out of $42 and I’m now embarrassed at a gift I gave to my grandson.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work AT ALL.  Guaranteed to Disappoint your child.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely does NOT WORK. At ALL. PROMISES to DISAPPOINT until you find it several months later when it can DISAPPOINT. AGAIN. Tried the slides it came with. A bug. A penny. 100% blurry no matter HOW you adjust it
customer_reviews.author: Tour NewEnglander

customer_reviews.title: A good starter set that has everything you need.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Christmas Present for my granddaughter and will complement the binocular low power scope she currently uses. This scope will allow her to move to smaller subjects of study. It is definitely a step up from the cheap Chinese scope I bought earlier which is very difficult to orientate and focus. I have only looked through it to make sure it would not be difficult or disappointing it is neither so I expect to stop at many bridges so she can be hunting pond scum in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Lewis

customer_reviews.title: This was perfect for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small microscope that I could start my 4 year old on exploring. This is the perfect size and the kit and case were perfect. It's easy enough to use and focus that she can do it on her own after a couple times using it with her. The case is sturdy and convenient. Can't wait to do the brine shrimp experiment with her and start making our own slides.
customer_reviews.author: Momma1701

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginner microscope kit for a young learner. I bought it for my 8 year old who has recently become interested in science stuff. The microscope itself seems to be of sturdy construction. The built-in light is a plus that some models don't have. The kit comes with all the tools one needs to start collecting specimens and making slides, as well as a few pre-made slides. The kit comes with some brine shrimp ("sea-monkeys") that one can hatch, but we were unable to get them to hatch, even after a couple of weeks in the salt water.
customer_reviews.author: T. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My boys are 4 and 7 and they were able to use this microscope with a little help. My 7 year old caught on quick and was able to adjust it independently. I was even able to put my iPhone camera right up to the lens and capture a few pictures of what they were seeing (slides with bacteria from a science experiment). Gave them something interesting and new to do during quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: hla110109

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kids a year ago when they were interested in rocks and bugs. While not an avid user of microscopes, I have had my day with them during graduation. My biggest beef is those lenses are with bubbly artifact even at the lowest power. I couldn't make out anything even at the lowest magnification. I put it away frustrated a year ago. Now with COVID, I pulled it out and tried again, making sure this is not a "user error". With the same result, I wouldn't recommend this microscope to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tijo Jose

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up from an experienced chemist!
customer_reviews.text: 6 yr old is AMAZED at the clarity and being able to see the specimens on the slides. I am a chemist and even I was impressed at the overall set up and options for experimentation. The focus can be a bit tricky, but once you get it the image is great considering how basic the scope is. This is a great starter kit for any child interested in science!
customer_reviews.author: RWJ

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality. The microscope is very cheap
customer_reviews.text: Not good quality. The microscope is very cheap. I couldn't give to my daughter because even at 10 I think she'd break it after little use. I returned. The only part of this that is metal is the handle. The rest is very cheap plastic. The container it comes in is better quality than the microscope. Even the lenses are plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't work at all... I got it for my daughter in August. She wasn't really interested so we didn't play around with it much. Tonight, she decided she wanted to check it out. We can't see anything. All we see is dust from the lens. It doesn't matter what slide is under it, magnification, or focus adjustment. We don't see anything. I'm outside of the return window but will be contacting Amazon to see if there is anything they can do. It's garbage.
customer_reviews.author: A123456

customer_reviews.title: Little Scientist get ready!
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this micoscope. He has said for 2 years now that he wants to be a scientist, so this was a perfect gift. It comes with so many neat things. There are 5 slides with things already on them and they are so neat to look at under the different colors. There are extra slides that you can put your own things on. There is also a brine shrimp hatchery! This is the most exciting thing for me, I can't wait to grow some little shrimp. I did install a battery in the bottom of the microscope in order for the light to work. The microscope has 3 magnifications and a focus. This is great for young scientists!!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Case and accessories are nice, microscope is lacking
customer_reviews.text: The case is nice, and I like the things that come with it, except for the microscope. It doesn't focus well and when you do try to focus it, the image moves around so you aren't looking at the same part on the slide anymore. That is frustrating for me as an adult, I can't imagine how frustrating it would be for a child. I will still give the kit to my niece, but I bought her a much better microscope to go along with it. My 4 year old nephew can play with this microscope since it won't matter if he breaks it or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good with caveats
customer_reviews.text: This is an OK kit if you experiment with it. The key for us was figuring out that the detents in the lens disc did not line up with the viewer. You had to put the numbers just to the left if the detent. Once you did that the microscope produced really great results. All the bits that went with it made it an adequate kit for the money and we aren't too worried about our son being rough with it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hook

customer_reviews.title: Great for YOUNG Beginners
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for something to do with your curious little scientist you should definitely get this. If you're stuck where you are due to COVID-19 or you just want to have something to do on a rainy day this is great. Not as high quality as you'd want/need for a tween, teen or adult beginner as the craftsmanship isn't designed that way. It is easier to use in smaller hands.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jen

customer_reviews.title: Quality is extremely bad
customer_reviews.text: Might be it was a good design idea but... Quality of manufacturing is extremely bad. - Eyepiece has a huge black particle debris inside between lenses, see picture. - Slides with samples contaminated with black hairs and dust, see picture - focus adjustment is flimsy - impossible to set at high magnification etc, etc Don't buy if you don't want to disappoint your kids the explorers!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Khitrov

customer_reviews.title: Great for school kids, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite impressed with the functionality of this microscope for this low price. My 6 year old kids are able to use it on their own after just a few times I showed them how to use it. The magnification level on our microscope is 300x, 600x, and 1200x. Kids are just amazed to see things they have never imagined existed.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Fun experiments to explore
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for my 11 year old grandson. He was so excited and said he always wanted one. I don't know what all he has done so all I can say is it was a nice surprise and looked like fun.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Crom

customer_reviews.title: Don't give up
customer_reviews.text: Not going to lie, I almost sent this back. It takes a lot of fidgeting to get it just right, but when you do, man oh man is it awesome. It is helpful to have a flashlight to shine closely to the microscope when you need more light. I have not had much success on anything except the 300x level. We have only been experimenting for a few days though. The shrimp hatchery is really awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is Amazing, comes with so much, more than what stores usually offer. It is a big nice set with some specimens already included to view. I was surprised at how big and nice this was, definitely worth buying! The microscope is plastic if you are looking for metal. I was hoping it would be metal but it is so nice you don't even worry about that. It's still a nice sturdy plastic, not flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Light is blindingly bright. Not normal.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good started kit but the primary lens had a large dark spot on the inside and the light was dangerously bright. For a child I would not reccomend just on safety alone regarding the light. Gave it 2 stars cause they did take it back no questions even though my son made a couple of his own slides.
customer_reviews.author: htwlrs

customer_reviews.title: Small and disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a bday gift. Highly disappointed by the size of scope. Very nice kit and carrying box but sent back because it didn’t impress at all. The scalpel blade was a bendy plastic and the scope never worked like it should. Sent back for a refund with no problem. Do not recommend. Sadly disappointed in its performance
customer_reviews.author: ANDRENIA RODGERS

customer_reviews.title: No thanks
customer_reviews.text: Have owned a microscope before I opened the box and put it right back in and returned. I can’t speak or anything other than it is made incredibly cheap! Literally felt like a Dollar Tree toy— I didn’t bother to try it. If you don’t know what a compatible price range can get you this may work just fine for your needs
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: OK but not very impressive.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I guess you get what you paid for. It is such a tiny microscope, adjusting the lens was such a pain. The small size of the scope makes it a bit difficult to look through without straining the neck so badly. I guess I should have invested in something slightly bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Maha A. Elbadry

customer_reviews.title: Works well, if you can figure it out
customer_reviews.text: The scope works great, BUT the lens does not match up with center of the viewing platform area. It took quite a while to figure out that the only way to see anything was to place the slide nearly out of range of the light and off the window. It definitely isn’t something my twelve year old would’ve figured out on his own. It’s a sturdy little set though, and it’s been fun to check out the slides.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Y

customer_reviews.title: For young kids only. A starter kit
customer_reviews.text: The slides that are made up in this package are plastic and you are unable to see, the gum media is completely dry, the magnification on the scope is not the best for viewing blood and it's components but will show basic structure but not able to see a clear definate picture. For hair, you can see the difference between basic structure but can't enlarge it to see exactly how its made up.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: This was a Santa gift to my daughter and she thought it was the coolest gift. It does come with iodine, other chemicals and a knife which I removed since she is younger. She loved looking through the slides and even adding our own stuff. I feel this is easy to use, we are still teaching her which buttons focus and which bring the item further or closer but other than that it is simple.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Masters

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality and user friendliness. Fun slides too.
customer_reviews.text: Really like the microscope performance and the included stuff to look at. My 3-year old daughter loves it! Easy to take photos and videos with iPhone camera.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nephew loved it! He wanted to check out ever little piece. He just turned 7 and was telling me about the plants he wanted to get samples from at home for looking at on the slides. The slides are sharp, so maybe not for all 7 yr olds, but he pays attention when told to be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my niece who is turning 5. I’m trying to get her into STEM so I got her this as well as some fun age appropriate science experiments. I think she will love it! It looks and feels like a professional microscope but for little hands to use confidently. I can’t wait to give it to her!
customer_reviews.author: Ivana Potter

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter LOVED IT
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter went wild over the microscope kit and didn't even finish opening the rest of her presents. She spent 5 straight hours doing experiments and viewing them with the microscope. Her mother had to take it from her so she could put her to bed. Mommy got up at 5:30AM to go to the bathroom and found her at the dinning room table with the microscope kit doing more experiments.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hyde Sr

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love this Microscope kit
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this Microscope kit. Something seems wrong with the light. its like it has a short in it or maybe its just made cheap. It will flutter on and off if you barley move the Microscope. The rest of it seems good but not sure about the light. Wondering if I'm the only one having this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S

customer_reviews.title: Microscopic wonders are waiting to be seen!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is all about science and this microscope kit has everything she needs to get started with exploring the microscopic universe! It is not a professional microscope by any means but then it says "Kids" right in the name so that should set the expectation right away. The carry case is nice for keeping everything together and safe. Nice gift for the curious scientist in your family.
customer_reviews.author: T-Rex

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for future scientists!
customer_reviews.text: This microscope is perfect for the little scientists! We got this for my daughter’s 9th birthday and she is in heaven. We purchased additional slides to observe and it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: Its not exactly as I expected. Its basically for beginners or children but works ok. Was expecting a bit more for the price tho. It did not come in a box to conceal what was inside. It came in a box as tho you were purchasing it in a store right off the shelf with a pic of it right on the box. Not the greatest idea for shipping when so many items get stolen off porches.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nagle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids
customer_reviews.text: The microscope is simple and basic. Great for the price. Unfortunately the accessories are cheap. It excludes a pipette for wet slide mounting. Comes with a plastic scalpel, which doesnt work. I understand safety is also a factor. The shrimp need yeast which is not included. My daughter has been in heaven since getting it. Overall good item.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: We weren't able to see a thing
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a birthday present for my 9yr old. He wasn't able to see a thing. I thought maybe it was because he wasn't doing it correctly. Maybe we got a bad one in the batch? I bought this based on the reviews and it was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN JANE JUNG

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made microscope
customer_reviews.text: The slides I purchased are many and varied... the microscope has such poor lenses that each slide looks much the same except abit of variation in color of the material. There is some focus capability, and 300x, 600x and 1200x powers. I would not recommend this microscope even for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!! Works well until it breaks!!
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this microscope 5 stars as a kids instrument that really worked. However we have only had it for a month. My kids use it about once a week and are super gentle with it. This week the focus knob stopped working and, of course, if you cannot focus then the microscope is useless. I contacted the company to see if they would replace the part and they told me that the wouldn't help me because I bought the microscope on Amazon. I would not give any business that is willing to take your money on amazon but then not help you when their product is subpar.
customer_reviews.author: Herman J. Hermanson

customer_reviews.title: Does not include everything for the brine shrimp experiment.
customer_reviews.text: The microscope itself is great for the price. Our problem came with the brine shrimp experiment. It said it came with everything we needed but it did not. The experiment requires pipettes and yeast which are not included and yeast is pretty hard to find right now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Price for what you get
customer_reviews.text: A little small, cheap, but you get a lot for the $, which is why I am giving it a 5 star review. Easy to use & set up. It also comes with already made slides and lost of supplies, plus batteries. We viewed the slides and a lot more other cool stuff. I do recommend this for beginners, for additional science projects... & especially for us homeschoolers!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Szabo

customer_reviews.title: Not all it's cracked up to  be
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this as I got it for my 9 year old brother who loves science. He was super excited and we followed all the directions, unfortunately none of the shrimp eggs hatched and all of the little dies and what not that came with the microscope were all garbage and stale(they were suppose to be liquid and were all hard). Bummer! We were able to get some dirt and leaves and look under the microscope which was cool. But looking at live shrimp was the whole reason I bought this- bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Kaydens Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: The kit is intended for kids (8 and up), and for that age group it is a great beginner microscope. As you can imagine, for that price you are not getting real lab grade equipment, but to introduce a young person to biology and the use of microscopes, it is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Iggity7

customer_reviews.title: High quality and easy to use! Fun way to connect with your kids!
customer_reviews.text: What a great purchase! My son loves science and this was the perfect gift. Good for beginners who love science. I was worried that the quality of the microscope wouldn’t be great but I took a chance and order anyway. I’m so glad I did! Everything you get is great quality and it came with fun and easy activities to do. I will be gifting this to my nephew next! Great to do with your kids and gets them off tablets/TVs.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this while it was on sale as a gift for my 8 year old, though the regular price looks reasonable as well. The set comes with some slides and a few other things that are really neat. The microscope is small and light-weight, but it works well and does what I'd expect for something of this caliber. I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMom7898

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, poor images, light too bright
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, cheap materials. I used microscopes in college and it was easy and fun. Bought this for my sons bday, and the light is soo bright it hurts your eyes, no way to dim it. The adjusting wheel, never fully gets item into focus. I would save some money, by spending a little more on a higher quality microscope.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Just like the microscope I had as a kid, except this one uses plastic slides
customer_reviews.text: LED works great, with brightness and ON/OFF easily adjusted by its swivel mechanism. Great images with little effort, but you must know how to use a microscope. Came with all the stuff in the vials and brief instruction guide. Yeah the lenses aren't that great, but I wasn't expecting perfection. There are few slight bubbles and minor imperfections in the views, but you can clearly make out the details of the specimens. I suspect the optics are plastic, but they seem to work well, all the way down to 1200x.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G Prucha

customer_reviews.title: Best Science investment for my child
customer_reviews.text: Great product to buy for first timers. Microscope does not have fine control but coarse is workable. This set has empty slides for experimentation, as well as, other useful accessories. Also comes with several premade slides to look at. Definitely recommend if you're looking for something to use to cover your child's science portion of learning.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: So much promise...hardware died on day one.
customer_reviews.text: Good lenses but the fine adjustment knob stripped out after a day's use. Lots of thought went into piecing together the slides and the rest of the kit, just not into a sturdy microscope. This is too technical for kids and not quite adequate for home science fun. Will look for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Allen G

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere. This microscope is cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I expected a nicer microscope for $40. The parts that are normally metal where plastic. The light is cheap. The whole thing doesn't seem like it will last long. I got this for my almost 8 year old for Christmas and I'm disappointed. Probably should have looked for a kids microscope my national geographic or some known company.
customer_reviews.author: Momma octopus

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: The microscope shipped out and arrived on time packaged well. It was purchased for a gift. It says aluminum. The middle part may be but the rest is cheap plastic. It's nearly impossible to get it to focus on anything. I would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: SLP

customer_reviews.title: spend $20 on a all metal microscope with coarse and fine adjustments
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 6 yo daughter. I knew the microscope was plastic based on the description but figured for a 6 yo this would be fine. However there were several issues. First the rack and pinion gears for the focus adjustment are just awful, and would only engage sometimes. Second, though the microscope says it will go up to 1200x this just isn't practical without fine adjustment. I ended up returning this microscope and buying a low end all metal microscope for about $20 USD more, it has coarse and fine adjustments to get the focus at higher imaginations not to mention the clarity improvements are 10 fold.
customer_reviews.author: jeb

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Low quality scope makes viewing hazy. Impossible to get a sharp focus. At first I thought it was the premade specimens but I tried them on another microscope and could see them clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Matu

customer_reviews.title: Beginners Microscope
customer_reviews.text: So pleased overall. This isn’t an amazing microscope but excellent as a starter set especially for children who may or may not take to it and won’t notice some of the quality nuances. This is great for a true beginner and with the price point, and expanded professional slide set is an easy add on later. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Box says for 8+ age group, manual says otherwise
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my 6 year old as the box says it's for 8+. I figured it would provide a healthy amount of challenges but not be too hard to use for that age group. BUT the manual says its for 13+ kids and it does seem geared towards older kids and if I had known that, I would've purchased a different microscope. Pretty bummed since this is not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Flood

customer_reviews.title: Greta way to get kids to explore science
customer_reviews.text: I think theres no substitute for grtting kids into science, and this an excellent way to help them understand that the big world is made of small things. This complete kit comes with a bunch od starter material to get kids exploring their world. It was a gift and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul3Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cheap. Nearly impossible to get into a nice focus
customer_reviews.text: I like the case and the assortment of items that it comes with, but the microscope itself is poor quality along with all the other Made-in-China items. Save your money is spend a little extra for something nicer. The optics in this microscope are not clear, and there is so much 'play' in the cheap parts that you can't really get it into focus as they flex so much with any adjustment. Overall, I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lutz

product_meta.title: AmScope 120X-1200X 52-pcs Kids Beginner Microscope STEM Kit with Metal Body Microscope, Plastic Slides, LED Light and Carrying Box (M30-ABS-KT2-W),White
feature_bullets: Beginner compound microscope provides high magnification for educational applications
Monocular viewing head with LED and mirror illumination and built-in color filter wheel
Forward-facing rotating turret provides 120x, 240x, 300x, 480x, 600x, and 1200x magnifications
Coaxial coarse focus has a rack-and-pinion focus mechanism on a durable and stain-resistant white metal frame
Comes with 52-piece accessory kit and hard-sided plastic ABS case

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
